title: Challenges of Real-Time Fatigue Detection
description: Discuss the need for low latency and fast processing in real-time applications. Analyze the computational demands of complex machine learning models.

examples.description: Develops a real-time GUI for monitoring driver alertness, demonstrating the practical applicability of the model in real-time.
examples.note: Added for its development of a real-time GUI, showcasing the practical implementation of fatigue monitoring in real-time scenarios.

examples.description: Aims to develop a low-power model suitable for deployment in devices with limited power resources for real-time monitoring.
examples.note: Added for its focus on developing a low-power model for real-time monitoring, addressing the challenge of limited power resources in real-time applications.

examples.description: Focuses on real-time detection capabilities using single-feature computation directly from EEG signals.
examples.note: Added for its emphasis on real-time detection using single-feature computation, which is crucial for timely interventions in safety-critical applications.

examples.description: Aims to develop a system capable of real-time fatigue detection to provide timely warnings.
examples.note: Added for its focus on developing a system for real-time fatigue detection, highlighting the importance of timely warnings in preventing accidents.

examples.description: Focuses on real-time monitoring of drowsiness in a wearable format with extended battery life.
examples.note: Added for its focus on real-time monitoring using wearable technology, which is essential for practical applications in fatigue detection.

examples.description: Aims for real-time drowsiness detection using a single EEG sensor, though the study itself is in a controlled setting.
examples.note: Added for its aim of real-time drowsiness detection using a single EEG sensor, although the real-world applicability needs further investigation.

examples.description: Aims for real-time fatigue detection, though the immediate applicability in real-time is noted as a limitation.
examples.note: Added for its aim towards real-time fatigue detection, acknowledging the challenges in achieving immediate real-time applicability.

examples.description: Focuses on real-time detection capabilities, though the study itself is based on simulated driving tasks.
examples.note: Added for its focus on real-time detection capabilities, although the study's reliance on simulated driving tasks raises questions about real-world applicability.

examples.description: Aims for real-time fatigue monitoring, though the current implementation requires further development for real-time application.
examples.note: Added for its aim towards real-time fatigue monitoring, highlighting the need for further development to achieve practical real-time application.

examples.description: Proposes an IoT Cloud solution for real-time alerts, though the focus of the paper is on reviewing existing techniques.
examples.note: Added for its proposal of an IoT Cloud solution for real-time alerts, showcasing an innovative approach to real-time fatigue monitoring.

examples.description: Aims for real-time monitoring using a wireless wearable EEG.
examples.note: Added for its aim of real-time monitoring using a wireless wearable EEG, demonstrating the feasibility of real-time fatigue detection in practical settings.

examples.description: Suggests future work should focus on real-time application of the fatigue detection method.

examples.description: Focuses on achieving low prediction times suitable for real-time applications.

trend: Focus on real-time processing and low latency for immediate feedback in safety-critical applications.
